place_description: Gibson Mill Market is a locally-sourced food hall located on the campus of historic Gibson Mill in Concord, NC.

reviews_data.review_text: Some of the food options on the website are no longer there.  They could have a few more activities. Other than that, great spot to meet up or hang out with people
Okay, it just didn't meet my expectations

Went with some girlfriends to enjoy some girl time...this place is lacking SO much.  The bar doesn't open until 4pm!  Why even have the bar as one of the main focal points when you walk in you can't even enjoy a cocktail with lunch?    Music is too quite, tables are dirty, the vibe just isn't there.

Our group ordered food from Taco Street and Johnny Roger's - both had amazing food and we will be leaving 5 star reviews for them because their service and offerings were top notch!

But the atmosphere in the place is so sad for all the potential it has
It's small, food options are limited, and it could use more vendors to actually compete with Optimist Hall. There is a cute game lounge there that could be a real gem if you're into stuff like that!
It's really cute and has a lot of options to choose from. Plus, if you over eat or drink, you can walk over to the antique mall and walk off all the food
Typical food hall experience.  The actual hall was very difficult to find once on the property.  Go in the upper parking lot.

lmkn jmyl wmGlq ytwfr bh mwqf mjny@.

ytwfr kwfy qhw@ mkhtSh wb`D mHlt lmkhbwzt wlT`m@ lmHly@.

Recently visited over the holiday weekend when they held the vendors market and was shocked to see how big the place was! A friend of mine was vending so we walked around and checked out many booths. I thought it was an amazing way for small business owners to get more exposure and gave families something to do with the kiddos. My only suggestion for the food shops is to offer more drink options aside from alcohol, beer, and canned sodas or bottled water, some fresh juices or lemonades would have been great!
The atmosphere is great. Lots to do. More than enough different food options.

Great quaint food court with brewery and game room on basement level. Had the Lobster Roll and Crab Cake burger from Barcos as well as a Cookies n Cream cookie from Cara's Cookie Co. all of which was amazing!! Been back again already and plan to make it a staple when in the area!
Hotdog, hot sausages, lemonade
Good

We took a ride here to check out the food hall and market.  The food hall was not crowded so we went around deciding on what to order.  We settled on the pizza place.  The pizza was excellent and service was great.

Unfortunately, most of the tables were dirty and no one going around cleaning them.  We had to put a bunch of napkins down and then place our food on their plates.

We were sitting in front of Thai Esane restaurant and there was a worker that had gloves on serving people.  That was great, but then when people walked away he was touching his hair with the gloves on and then took a napkin and wiped his nose.  Again his gloves were still on!   So apparently, he was serving people with the same gloves.  So, that was really unhygienic and we will not be back to visit this market to eat.

Expensive but I guess nowhere else to go. $12 for 2 tacos. Yes, they were quesabirria but COME ON. Tacos were soggy and I've never had bad quesabirria. Would not order these again. Needs to be at least 3 tacos for $12 in my opinion.
Well food is good. First order bread is free first order only. No free refills on sodas but tea you do. FYI $$$

Went here for the first time about a week ago. The Thai food was so good I returned with my husband a few days later. There's a bunch of options for different types of food which was great. Children won't eat Thai yet so we ordered them a pizza. One recommendation would be to have some high chairs for those with littles. I was told they may add a comedian/concert hall here. This would be a fantastic addition!

Decided to have lunch at Barcos Sports & Seafood. Worst decision I made all year when it comes to food choices.
I orddered the Seared Tuna and Barcos Salad. After placing order at 5 33 I receive an alert at 5 36 my food was ready.
Surprised how quick the turn around I
touched the tuna and it was luke warm...so dissapointed.
The salad was nothing special..lettus tomato cucumber and cheese.
Went back to the counter to let them know about the tuna being luke warm at best.
All the lady said was its supposed to be red in the middle.
I just shook my head. Of course its supposed to be red but not served luke warm.
3 entire minutes from order to being ready...
Wasted my $23 plus tip.
Food is less than satisfactory.
Think twice b4 you order food ans lets start tipping after food is received.

The place is very open and cool.

The food was ok, perfect for drinking. We had a pizza which was ok. A lobster roll from one of the Mexican places, and it was not defrosted properly (the texture was weird) and crabcake bites that were tasty. The best food we had was from the Mexican on the left side, we had a Caribbean bowl that was fresh and tasty.

All the tables were sticky, and it seems like not enough seating available for the number of people they get.
We really didn't  get to try the food because they were closed and didn't open until 10am. But it is  beautiful scenery.

Went on a Sunday and some restaurant were closed. Something about this place was lacking. Definitely not an optimist hall or Camp North End. Food here is decent and I had some yummy crab balls here yesterday . The cookies are amazing!

Super expensive... $15 for chicken fingers and fries. $17 for a 12 inch pizza, $6 for a single taco!?

Kids running around with no adults caring at all that their kids are disruptive.

No security anywhere, nobody working the doors, etc. no presence whatsoever if something were to happen.

No animals allowed, but nobody to stop anybody from bringing them in regardless if they are service animals. Seen numerous dogs in bags, or just people bringing in large dogs.

No outside food allowed but I watched a family bring an entire large pizza in from another establishment with other items and sit down and eat.

Cleaning leaves a lot to be desired all over as garbage is frequently over flowing. Cleaners drink on the job too as you can see one of them with a cup of beer in their hands multiple times a shift.

Concrete is dirty, flower beds and mulch is filled with trash, brick hasn't been power washed/cleaned etc. no care given to the exterior of the building.

Always hot inside, air conditioning doesn't seem to work correctly or efficiently given it's a new build and the units should be new.

Not enough parking for anybody. A parking ramp is desperately needed. You only need two floors max to have enough space or expand the parking lot asap.

Cookies are the best thing there but I heard they are being run out soon for another business. So hopefully someone steps their quality up!

It's an ok place to go if you have absolutely nothing to do and you're bored. Not what I was expecting. I love the concept of having food court style place. The game room stuck out the most. Putting all the boardgames out from my childhood was awesome!

If you live close, then it's a cool place to chill. If you live over 30 minutes away, eh... Not so much.
This place is great! It has plenty of food spots to try and several bars to enjoy. Will be visiting again soon!
Really neat hang out place. Lots of options for variety of food for everyone.  Seating areas are comfortable and plentiful.

This place does not give me family friendly energy at all. I visited Johnny Roger's and the female at the register was very rude, unfriendly, unprofessional and so unwelcoming and uninterested in assisting me with my order that I walked away and refused to give them my money. Missed the name of pizza place but same thing, went there and female stood at the register and did not greet us, ask how she could help us, if we had any questions, etc. The taco place could work on their customer service as well and their food was just mediocre. The place serving the lobster rolls were very slow in service time and food was disappointing . This was our first and last visit to Gibson Mill Market.
The birria tacos I ordered were not good at all. But the food I ate off of, from Johnny Rockets was amazing! Will be back for JR

This was our first time visiting Gibson Mill Market. There are plenty of options for everyone and we all decided to try something different from different restaurants. We tried cheese pizza, pulled pork sandwich and fries and fish and chips. The  cheese pizza and fish and chips were hot but lacked flavor. The sandwich had flavor but was served cold. Overall, we will visit Gibson Mill Market again and try other restaurants.

Cute food hall in the heart of Concord, NC. Nice place where you can sit and relax either indoors or outdoors. They have a decent selection of restaurants. Mexican, Pizza, BBQ, coffee, Cookies, Brewery and more. So they have something for everyone.
Great place for lunch or an afternoon round of axe throwing.  We had a ball here
Great options for food, beer from High Branch, and games.  Fun on a beautiful afternoon
Great food in a neat location.

The environment was nice and chill but the food was not appealing to my taste there was no seasoning or flavor to the BBQ and street tacos stand . Was very displeased and disappointed. Was very excited to try but feel like I wasted my money and my date wasn't pleased at all .
Great place
Great place! Similar to Optimist Hall, or a mini Ponce Market in Atlanta. Love restored mills used for food and entertainment.
Just an awesome place and all the food vendors are fantastic.  Just go there if you haven't already.

Great place to spend a whole day or grab a quick bite and enjoy the atmosphere.
Live music and poker nights are fun.
Kid friendly and off course 2 local breweries to enjoy are a plus!
And if you want to play a board game with your friends and enjoy a drink and hangout definitely check out the lower level!

Gibson Mill Market is a step back in time.  The food court offers many very good options from barbecue to lobster rolls.  There's a very well conceived escape room opportunity with several different escape rooms to choose from.  The history of Gibson Mill is not forgotten.  You'll find fascinating photographs on the walls depicting the young children who worked in the factories in our area, revealing the story.

Overall, we found the Gibson Mill Market family friendly, safe, clean, and the food delicious. However, getting out of the antique store was a maze, a potential fire hazard. I would recommend direction arrows.
New additions of indoor food hall - two breweries plus more

I have visited Gibson Mill Market several times in the past few weeks as a place to get some reading done. It's a good place to come alone to work quietly or with a small group to meet. There is a great coffee shop, several places to buy food, and a lot of comfortable places to sit. A favorite feature of this place for me is that the tabletops are all apparently made from wood that was 'harvested' from an old mill like this one.
I had the Spanish food booth. Sorry I forgot the name. The food was delicious
Excellent coffee shop!
A very cool food hall tucked away in Concord. They had a live music day

Hope was an excellent server.  Hope gave good recommendations to our table of six.  Everyone  was pleased  with their selection of food and drinks.  Delicious salad.  Nice and fresh.  Cilantro dressing was a nice change of pace for me.  Prickly pear drink with vodka was very sweet.  Had to water it down with club soda.  Two drinks were enough for the whole night.  Hope was an excellent server.  We played cards at her table since it wasn't very busy but we left her an extra $20 in tip to make up for monopolizing the table for almost two hours.  We moved downstairs for the second half of girls night out.  Beer selection was excellent according to my friends.
Look forward to trying more meals here!

Variety of food, reminds you of a food truck or mall setting with numerous options. The pizza was great from a local vendor. Parking is very adequate for the building as it was very busy after we got there. A lot of people started trickling in and the entire hall was at capacity. Come early on Saturday like 5: 30ish as you will maybe find a seat. There is quite a bit of tables and chairs but they can go quick if it's a busy night. Some food vendors were busier than others at different points depending on what kind of food you want.
Great place. Variety of food venues. Will definitely be going again . We went to the new Spanish food venue in
It was empty whenni went but i love that so no complaints from me. Best burger ive had in a while that goat cheese was just chefs kiss. And pricing was fabulous for the amount of food you get
Great pizza vendor and coffee shop in this place.
Great place for dinner - few spots to choose from and small arcade for kids.
Had live music
Fun. Nice. Cozy. Family Friendly. Lots of good options.
Great food. Cookie place we've done it twice and the cookies are really dense almost hard, some people like that, I don't . I like soft and chewy. Tacos are good and burger place is great!!
What a cool vibe at the Gibson Mill Market! The food was a little pricey but definitely top quality. Followus@johncauble via Facebook
Churn and Defined Coffee are my favorite stops when spending a day shopping at Gibson Mill. The tacos are great, too.

I found out about GMM via a CLTEats post on Instagram. It boasts two separate bars, one with actual cocktails and wine, several varieties of restaurants to choose from (Mexican, BBQ, Neapolitan-style brick oven pizza, ice cream, etc), a coffee shop and a small arcade, and not advertised in the IG clip is a board game cafe!! You can pay per player for a table and get to play any board game or work any puzzle available on the shelves (think like a coffee shop-style bookstore) OR you can purchase new games, puzzles, or gaming accessories in their retail space. You can find something to satisfy anyone's cravings, even if you take a group of several people!!
Decent variety of food wish there were more. The taco place was good. Burger place was ok. Pizza was good. Cookies were awesome.
Wonderful place to sit down with friends and family or whip out the laptop and work a while.
The gyro sandwich was dry You guys should go with a chopped gyro the meat  We'll be more and more Moist
Great place to chill and enjoy a great meal
Super beautiful place to spend 4 hours looking at stuff.  Do not bring children here.
This place has a little bit of everything.  Great spot
My favorite place to go on a rainy day. I never leave empty handed! Enjoyed Baracoa nachos and Beer after.

Excellent experience at the bar.
Our bartender was amazing!
Great drinks and great recommendations.
We enjoyed it so much.

I recently discovered this place, and I can't say much about the food yet.  Defined coffee and the ice cream place have been my only try there, and the atmosphere is welcoming.  Great large spaces are available both outside and inside, ideal for meetings and remote working.  The lunch traffic picks up around 11a. and dies down around 1pm.  This place has great potential, I'm just not quite sure if it's advertised well.
Wonderful experience with TONS to do and see.
This is a great place for lunch or a snack or coffee. Very cool repurposing of an old mill building. I'll definitely be back

Went around 3pm on a Wednesday really slow but we went to the barcos place and it was great! The cheesy beef roll was amazingly seasoned! The lobster roll my brother thought it would've been better hot but I think it was nice chilled, the crab roll was amazing I liked it alot ! It was so good we forgot to take pics lol
Delicious pizzas  berry authentic! Definitely loved it.

Optimistic food hall is a perfect description. This is a food hall connected to a game room. It hits on looks. The bones and plan are right. The execution leaves way too much to be desired.

The complex is a redevelopment of an old mill/factory. You enter the "market" by way of a bridge from the antique mall part of the complex.
There are 6-7 eateries/bar/desert shops within a large building. Hence the market moniker. The bar seems to do a good business.

We walked around looking at the various restaurants... taco place (taco street)- staff was sitting and leaning on the counters - No customers. Pass. Next was a burger and BBQ place (Johnny Rogers) couple of people eating here and it looked ok. So we decided to try. Asked the counter girl which was her favorite the BBQ or the burger. She said she didn't really like either.  Hmm should have taken that advice.  However I ordered the BBQ with fries.  Not good. $33 and I threw mine in the trash. Super heavy clove spice.  Just heavy ughh food. The oil the fries were cooked in probably had not been changed in three weeks...yuck. Just garbage.

There is a pizza place, and Indian restaurant, an ice cream shop, cookie shop and coffee shop.

We did get a chocolate chip cookie for $5. It was ok. Consistency of a doughy dense slightly undercooked.  It was ok.

Really wish we had not eaten here.
You could take a whole church group here, game group, girls night out, or host a family party here. Lots of food options. Clean. Bathrooms very clean.

Went for lunch. Kudos to the developers. This place is gorgeous and has a wonderful choice of restaurants in the food hall. We tried the street tacos and an Asian fusion bowl. Both were delicious. Outside seating was great. Can't wait to go in the evening!
Great place to get a bite and a drink. Prices on drinks are a little high though.

This is for Barcos at the Market.  Less than impressed with the menu.  The Mahi itself was okay but the rice bed lacked flavor, it was colorful but basically flavorless.  The tuna poke is over powered by fresh ginger.  At least the place was clean and staff was very nice.
Love defined coffee! Such a great spot to grab a meal with friends, family, or date night. So many good options!
Churn Buddies Ice cream is the best!
Good tacos...
Ate at Johnny Rogers Bar B Que and it was very tasty
Awesome place to purchase not only antiques but present day items as well!
Place has plenty of nostalgia and good eats to boot. The antiques are a slightly overpriced tho imo.
Lots of food choices in the market. Nice place to spend an evening with friends.

We had some great drinks at The Market Bar and just hung out on the porch.  We ended up going down to Cabarrus Brewing for beers and dinner, which were all wonderful.  There are several places to chose from for a meal in The Market, along with a very busy coffee shop.  All around a great place!
Lots of options for food and drinks. A great place to meet friends, grab lunch or work for a little!

Went with my SIL and we had a great time. I'm sure it will get better as more opens. Got dumplings from one place the shrimp and ginger and they were very bland unfortunately, adding a dumpling sauce would be a good idea for them. Chili cheese fries from another place that were awesome! A great portion for a great price. Would go back for those. And a taco from another place that was overflowing with steak. I'd be back, although I didn't care for their chimichurri. It felt too large of a cut to be a sauce and it was a weird flavor to me. The cookie place and icecream places were both not opening until 4 so that was a bummer. Had we not had the babies we would've checked out the arcade. Overall great experience though.
Great variety of food, food is good but be prepared to spend some money, it's not cheap. Good music good vibes.

A good place to grab a bite to eat or a drink after shopping for antiques next door. Also close proximity to a couple breweries. It looks like more options are opening soon as well. A great way to spend a day during the weekend.
Excited to see Gibson Mill grow. Hopefully it doesn't end up over priced like Optimist Hall.

Tried Kuni's and Taco Street. Kuni's was horrible. Dumplings were pan seared hard. Noodles with shrimp in peanut sauce tasted like wide noodles tossed in some Jif peanut butter and topped with nuts...so disappointing! Taco street was ok, tacos had tons of cilantro and very mushy but the flavor was good. Best thing we had was the 2 drinks from the bar Americano Spritzer and Cherry Paloma.

Great place to visit for shopping,  food/drink, and atmosphere!!  Dog friendly to well-behaved pets (can't go inside food hall, though).   Cara's Cookies are well worth it and are absolutely incredible!!!  Didn't get chance to visit Cabarrus Brewery, but it looked like it would be a great time!!  Definitely will be back frequently.
Great options with great food!
Fix the hours on Sunday for the restaurants
Great eatery with a super variety of local culinary creativeness! Great atmosphere!
Great food and excellent variety of food all in one location!!!
Always an amazing experience. Great staff and atmosphere.

So excited for the Gibson Mill makeover. Tacos, cocktails, coffee OH MY! We skipped antiquing and went for a family fun Escape Room Adventure. The staff was incredible. Making this our hang out spot for the foreseeable future. (Can't wait for the arcade to open )
My favorite spot to have a study session that lasts from coffee to lunch tacos, the atmosphere is lovely, the people are fantastic, the food & drinks are delicious.
Have great companies in Gibso. Mills. From coffee to Cara's Cookies. You will not be disappointed.

I only give it two Stars because I only tried the taco spot and it was horrible, the bowl with the huge piece of steak was not tasty, it was bland and pricey, hopefully they will add more restaurants to this very cool location, I definitely will be back to try the BBQ spot.

Only for johnny rogers, the food is great and so is service! I go atleast 1 a week but taco street is a real disappointment.. coming from a Hispanic. The food is so trash.. the esquite has tajin in it, and it looks more milky then anything. Baleada doesn't look authentic. Tacos aren't even flavorful...

Went to Taco Street for the first time today. I'm not sure the 1 star review has ever had tacos outside of Taco Bell or something, but the tacos are amazing. And their quesabirria is to die for. Definitely returning for more.
Forgot order for dinner then served cold food. Rude. Horrible experience

We have tried Taco Street twice, Johnny Roger's BBQ & Burgers once, and Defined Coffee twice.
Taco Street: Caribbean and Cuban Bowls were delicious.
Johnny Roger's: BBQ platters were good with plenty of BBQ. Red slaw, white slaw, and fried okra were all on point. Not a fan of sliced white bread and rather they skip that.
Defined Coffee: Coffee & service great. They only have light & medium roast (I live for dark roast). Also have kombucha ON TAP.
Looking forward to seeing the growth with other vendors.

Optimistic food hall that needs more love. There are currently two food places open, Johnny's Burgers and BBQ and Taco Street. Johnny's had fast and friendly service. Their bbq bowl was a great sampler of baked beans, mac n cheese, cole slaw, and pulled pork bbq. They had four sauces from the traditional vinegar bbq and the thicker sauce. Taco Street had a longer wait and straightforward service for two street tacos and taco bowl. All of the food tasted great. There is a coffee shop at the entrance then a beer hall downstairs, but it is mostly lacking where more places will open. I can't wait to see it in the future and try more local places!

It is in its Early Phase on Opening up.
But it will have many Choices of Food directly above Breweries.
The look and feel of the design is very inviting.
Taco Street was horrendous. Waited 20 minutes for the smallest and worst tacos I have ever eaten.
Excited to see more that is to come. We are at newest location of Johnny's Roger's BBQ.. Taco street looked like great option too. Can't wait to check out game spot:)
Here for the driving school with my son.
We are super excited for Gibson Mill Market when it opens!
